#summary The SVG <text> element represents a fragment of text.

You are here: [Welcome Home] > [SVGElements SVG Elements] > *text element*

= Introduction =

The text element is used to include scalable text into an SVG image.  The text can be scaled, rotated, skewed, stroked with paint, filled with a gradient, selectable, searchable.

= Details =
== Usage ==

{{{
<text fill="blue" font-size="30" x="10" y="100">Some SVG Text</text>
}}}

== Attributes ==

Common attributes:

  * [http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/text.html#TextElementXAttribute x] - The x coordinate of the current text position.
  * [http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/text.html#TextElementYAttribute y] - The y coordinate of the current text position.

== Caveats ==

  * The text element does not wrap text, see the tspan elements or the textarea element in SVGT 1.2
  * Mozilla does not support selecting SVG text yet
  * No browsers support finding SVG text on the page yet

= Reference =

  * [http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG11/text.html#TextElement The <text> element in SVG 1.1]
